page.title: 18ATTITUDES AND OPINIONS
page.content: The two settlements are so different in social and economic character that it is not surprising to find contrasting views among their inhabitants. In Carrington,the major concern centres on the recent closure of the Primary School because the roll of the one teacher school had fallen to 2 pupils. The nearest primary school is in the neighbouring village of Temple,a mere 1.3 miles (2.1km) away by direct road. This was acceptable but the Lothiam Region has failed to make safe a bridge on that road, and a diversion involving 5.3 miles (8.5km) now adds considerably to the journey time between the two villages, not to mention cost and inconvenience. Also, since the school closure, families have moved into Carrington and there are now 10 pre-school children.
